works.description: The article titled: "Preventing Hair Breakage" is infringed (via spinning my content) by the text excerpted on the site beginning with the text, "Occasionally we use items to maintain the health of our hair or achieve a specific style. Then there are times we use certain items to alter the condition of our hair also its rate regarding growth. Sadly, hair care items carry out not make hair grow. However, certain products plus ingredients, with combination with the way we handle our hair, can affect the usual rate of hair growth. "

The article titled: "Hair Breakage" is infringed (via spinning my content) by the text excerpted on the site beginning with the text, "Ethanol (commonly known as alcohol) yous damaging to the hair. Ethanol is denatured for use in products that are not consumed; for hair treatment products, it is listed as SD (specially denatured) alcohol. Used largely on styling products, these kinds of whereas hair gels and hairsprays, SD alcohol allows for these products to dry quickly on the hair. Unfortunately, SD alcohol also dries out the hair itself, eventually leaving it brittle and prone to breakage."
